landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges a tenancy commencing June 1, 2022, monthly rent of $2,200, and that Defendant is the owner/landlord of the Premises—facts that sufficiently plead a landlord-tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant commenced and/or permitted the adjacent-unit Renovation and that Defendant and/or contractors performed the work and notified Plaintiff—pleading an act/omission by the landlord.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges prolonged, persistent daytime construction noise (drilling, hammering, loud conversation 8 a.m.–5 p.m. on most weekdays for ~2 months) and recurring dust intrusion, and alleges these conditions materially interfere with Plaintiff's ability to work and enjoy the premises—facts that sufficiently plead a substantial interference.

causation.reasoning: Complaint links the noise and dust directly to the Renovation (which Defendant permitted/caused) and alleges the Renovation is the direct and proximate cause of the interference, thereby pleading causation.

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges concrete harms (loss of use and enjoyment, interference with work, annoyance, diminished tenancy value) and estimates monetary damages of approx. $600 to date, which adequately pleads damages.
